item.title: 聊天机器人妄想症：人工智能是否助长了新的心理健康危机？
item.description:
一些用户在与 ChatGPT 和其他机器人进行马拉松式的会话过程中与现实失去了联系。【原文：

Some users are losing touch with reality during marathon sessions with ChatGPT and other bots.

】

item.title: 美国消费者信心降至逾三年低点
item.description: 由于政府关门影响了经济前景，高物价又使人们对个人财务状况的看法变差，美国消费者情绪跌至三年多来的最低点。【原文：US consumer sentiment fell to a more than three-year low as the government shutdown weighed on the economic outlook and high prices soured views about personal finances.】

item.title: 人工智能反弹乏力，美股将结束周线连胜
item.description: 由于投资者继续担心科技行业估值过高，周五美国股市延续跌势，使基准股指有望中断连续一周的涨势。【原文：US stocks extended declines on Friday, putting benchmarks on track to snap a string of weekly gains as investors continued to fret about stretched valuations in the tech sector.】

item.title: 美国出资 4.65 亿美元支持 Serra Verde 的巴西稀土项目
item.description: 巴西稀土生产商 Serra Verde 从美国国际开发金融公司获得了多达 4.65 亿美元的资金，因为西方国家正寻求减少稀土这种关键矿产对中国的依赖。【原文：Brazilian rare earths producer Serra Verde secured as much as $465 million in funding from the US International Development Finance Corporation as Western nations seek to reduce reliance on China for the key minerals.】

item.title: 中国将于本月晚些时候出售 40 亿欧元主权债券
item.description: 中国已宣布计划在本月晚些时候出售多达 40 亿欧元（46 亿美元）的欧元国债，本周早些时候的 40 亿美元债务销售墨迹未干。【原文：China has unveiled plans to sell up to €4 billion ($4.6 billion) of euro-denominated government bonds later this month, with the ink barely dry on a $4 billion debt sale earlier this week.】

item.title: 高盛集团的帕斯夸里洛说，风险平衡有利于股票牛市
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Traders are pondering a moment of weakness embedded in a multi-month rip higher for stocks, yet the market on balance looks poised for further gains, said Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s Tony Pasquariello.】

item.title: 苹果音乐面临失去下一代听众的风险
item.description:
该服务缺乏免费层级可能会使其在音乐消费者（尤其是新兴市场的音乐消费者）心目中的前景黯淡

。【原文：

The service’s lack of a free tier might be dimming its prospects with music consumers, particularly in emerging markets

】

item.title: 土耳其在 "高利贷 "调查中拘留私人银行董事长
item.description: 土耳其一家私人银行的董事长被当局指控 "放高利贷 "和洗钱而遭到拘留。【原文：The chairman of a private Turkish bank was detained after authorities accused him of “loan sharking” and money laundering.】

item.title: 纳格尔说：如果局势恶化，欧洲应酝酿对华行动
item.description: 德国联邦银行行长约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）表示，如果与中国的贸易关系继续恶化，欧洲应考虑对中国采取措施。【原文：Europe should consider measures against China if trade ties with the Asian nation continue to deteriorate, according to Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel.】

item.title: 世界银行称飓风过后牙买加巨灾债券有望获得全额赔付
item.description: 据世界银行称，在飓风梅利莎引发全面触发事件后，牙买加巨灾债券的投资者现在面临着 100% 的赔付。【原文：Investors in Jamaica’s catastrophe bond now face a 100% payout after Hurricane Melissa set off a full trigger event, according to the World Bank.】

item.title: 加拿大就业人数增加 6.66 万人，失业率降至 6.9
item.description: 加拿大经济在 10 月份增加了 6.66 万个就业岗位，连续第二个月实现就业岗位的意外增长，否则关税将减缓经济活动。【原文：The Canadian economy added 66,600 jobs in October, marking a second consecutive month of surprise employment gains as tariffs otherwise slow down economic activity.】

item.title: Pimco 敦促 Milei 在 "形势大好 "时让比索自由浮动
item.description: 在哈维尔-米莱伊准备周五在纽约与投资者会面之际，基金巨头太平洋投资管理公司（Pacific Investment Management Co：让比索自由浮动。【原文：As Javier Milei prepares to meet with investors in New York on Friday, fund giant Pacific Investment Management Co. has a clear message for the Argentine president: Let the peso float freely.】

item.title: 俄罗斯上月原油产量上升，但仍低于欧佩克+配额
item.description: 俄罗斯的原油产量在 10 月份略有上升，但仍低于欧佩克+配额，因为国际社会对该国能源行业的压力越来越大。【原文：Russia’s crude oil production edged up in October, but remained below its OPEC+ quota as international pressure mounted on the country’s energy sector.】

item.title: 聊天机器人引发学生监控新时代
item.description:
随着美国教育工作者在课堂上使用人工智能，一些公司正在销售可标记自残内容的软件，这引发了人们对隐私和控制权的担忧。【原文：

 As US educators embrace AI in the classroom, firms are selling software to flag mentions of self-harm, raising concerns over privacy and control.

】

item.title: 美国停摆加剧了 2005 年以来最糟糕的货币交易年
item.description: 由于经济数据匮乏，美元前景蒙上阴影，美国政府有史以来最长的一次停摆使货币交易商陷入数十年来最糟糕的一年。【原文：The longest US government shutdown in record is consigning currency traders to their worst year in decades as a dearth of economic data clouds the outlook for the dollar.】

item.title: 奥林巴斯裁员，新领导班子精简运营
item.description: 奥林巴斯公司（Olympus Corp. ）新任首席执行官鲍勃-怀特（Bob White）在经历了前任因药物丑闻下台的艰难时期后，正在对这家总部位于东京的医疗设备制造商进行调整。【原文：Olympus Corp.’s new Chief Executive Officer Bob White is shaking up the Tokyo-based medical devices maker after a difficult period that included the ouster of his predecessor in a drug scandal.】

item.title: Tikehau 股价暴跌，长期支持者淡马锡减持股份
item.description: Tikehau Capital SA 在长期股东淡马锡以折扣价出售其在该公司的部分股份后，创下了该公司自 2017 年首次公开募股以来的最大跌幅。【原文：Tikehau Capital SA dropped the most since the company’s 2017 initial public offering after long time shareholder Temasek sold part of its stake in the company at a discount.】

item.title: 贸易峰会后中国恢复从美国公司进口大豆
item.description: 中国取消了暂停向三个美国供应商购买大豆的禁令，进一步缓解了北京和华盛顿之间在农产品贸易方面的紧张关系。【原文：China has lifted its suspension on soybean purchases from three American suppliers, further easing tensions over agricultural trade between between Beijing and Washington.】

item.title: 总统寻求削减能源法案，华沙水电费下降
item.description: 波兰电力公司周五在华沙出现下滑，因为总统卡罗尔-纳夫罗基（Karol Nawrocki）在向议会提交的新法律中提出了一系列削减电费的措施。【原文：Polish power utilities declined in Warsaw on Friday as President Karol Nawrocki proposed cutting the electricity bill in a series of measures included in a new law he filed with the parliament.】

item.title: 墨西哥降息后 10 月通胀率略有下降
item.description: 就在墨西哥央行连续第 11 次降息的第二天，墨西哥 10 月份的年度通胀率放缓，符合预期。【原文：Mexico’s annual inflation slowed in line with expectations in October, just a day after the central bank delivered an 11th straight interest rate cut.】

item.title: 欧洲电价将因风力减弱和暖流而大幅波动
item.description: 不断变化的天气模式将推动欧洲电力市场剧烈波动，下周初风力减弱，价格上涨，几天后天气转暖，太阳能发电量激增。【原文：Changing weather patterns are set to drive sharp swings in Europe’s power market, with prices rising early next week as winds weaken before giving way to a warm spell and a surge in solar generation a few days later.】

item.title: 中国推动本土石油钻探 摆脱进口依赖
item.description:
对国内勘探的巨额投资将不可避免地渗透到全球市场。【原文：

Huge investments in domestic exploration will inevitably filter through to global markets.

】

item.title: Rightmove 幻灯片显示投资者对更高支出需求的担忧
item.description: 欧洲股票投资者正在得到一个严酷的提醒：为在竞争中保持领先而增加开支，对股票来说并不一定是件好事。【原文：European stock investors are getting a stark reminder that increased spending to stay ahead of the competition isn’t necessarily a good thing for equities.】

item.title: 人工智能革命是手机购买者的事后思考
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，弗拉德-萨沃夫（Vlad Savov）将探讨在 ChatGPT 首次亮相多年后，人工智能仍未能引起智能手机买家的共鸣。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Vlad Savov looks at the failure of AI to resonate with smartphone buyers years after the seminal debut of ChatGPT.】

item.title: 英国央行在利率问题上的千钧一发不能掩盖预算案的戏剧性
item.description: 英国面临数十亿英镑的公共财政缺口【原文：The UK is confronting a multi-billion-pound hole in the public finances】

item.title: 杰斐逊称美联储接近中性时应缓慢行事
item.description: 美联储副主席菲利普-杰斐逊（Philip Jefferson）表示，鉴于利率已下调至更接近既不限制也不刺激经济的中性水平，美国央行应谨慎行事。【原文：Federal Reserve Vice Chair Philip Jefferson said the US central bank should move cautiously given that interest rates had been lowered closer to a neutral level that neither restricts nor stimulates the economy.】

item.title: 世界杯体育场建造商计划在摩洛哥首次公开募股，为大量订单提供资金
item.description: 为 2030 年国际足联世界杯建造世界上最大体育场之一的摩洛哥公司计划在卡萨布兰卡证券交易所上市并举债，以帮助其为创纪录水平的订单提供资金。【原文：The Moroccan firm building one of the world’s biggest stadiums for the 2030 FIFA World Cup plans to list its shares on the Casablanca stock exchange and raise debt to help it fund a record level of orders.】

item.title: 利润增长，KKR 信贷为四年来最佳筹资业绩提供动力
item.description: 受信贷产品创纪录需求的推动，KKR & Co.公布了四年多来筹资情况最好的一个季度，盈利超出华尔街预期。【原文：KKR & Co. reported its best fundraising quarter in more than four years, driven by record demand for its credit products, as earnings topped Wall Street expectations.】

item.title: 小众芯片股成为欧洲下一个人工智能大热门
item.description: 追逐下一个人工智能赢家的欧洲股票投资者盯上了一个新目标。【原文：European stock investors chasing the next artificial-intelligence winner have latched on to a new target.】

item.title: 斯里兰卡预算以投资和改革为目标，保护国际货币基金组织的救助计划
item.description: 斯里兰卡总统阿努拉-库马拉-迪萨纳亚克（Anura Kumara Dissanayake）在提交 2026 年国家预算时承诺进行改革，以确保国际货币基金组织 30 亿美元的救助计划按计划进行，并宣布了吸引投资的措施，以维持经济从历史性违约中复苏。【原文：Sri Lanka President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, presenting the nation’s 2026 budget, pledged reforms to keep a $3 billion International Monetary Fund bailout on track and announced measures to attract investments for sustaining the economy’s recovery from a historic default.】
